summary: "Retro" styled program for low level management of long paths.
descriptionHtml:
[center]As you might well know, games are getting bigger and bigger and bigger.

 Sooner or later, Windows_Users will run into the MAX_PATH barrier in the process of modding their games 
 Many programs are using the 32k limit, but the Explorer Shell is hampered by the MAX_PATH limitation.
You only get to know this when attempting to manually copy or delete files from directories using explorer.

So this is where Bigger Directories chimes in.
 Want to copy to or delete a file in a folder explorer can't?
Well you can now.
Want to create or delete a folder explorer can't?
Well, it's possible.
More info at [url=http://www.codeproject.com/Tips/1089681/Bigger-Directories]CodeProject[/url] & [url=https://github.com/lmstearn/Bigger-Directories/wiki/Bigger-Directories!]GitHub[/url] & [url=http://www.theassimilationlab.com/forums/topic/15480-testing-alpha-pre-release-code-anyone/]Assimilation Lab[/url]

Issues: Windows 10 Users will get a Smartscreen popup. Select [font=Times New Roman][b]More Info[/b] [/font]and [font=Times New Roman][b]Run Anyway[/b][/font].

 [size=5]BIgger Directories ought to be enough for anyone. -[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/5024569/?]lmstearn[/url][/size][/center]
author: lmstearn

files.name: Bigger Directories
